snippet: The Human Rights Institute Gallery at Kean University has on view through May 10 an exhibition of 20 quilts made from survivors of human rights abuses around the world.
abstract: Exhibit Advocacy Quilts: A Voice for the Voiceless, at Human Rights Institute at Kean University in Union, includes more than 20 quilts made by nearly 300 survivors of human rights abuses around the world (Metropolitan/New Jersey).
lead_paragraph: The Human Rights Institute Gallery at Kean University has on view through May 10 an exhibition of 20 quilts made from survivors of human rights abuses around the world.

headline.seo: Insights from Survivors of Abuse, Sewn Together
headline.main: Survivors’ Stories of Abuse, Sewn Tight
headline.print_headline: Survivors’ Stories of Abuse, Sewn Tight

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
